Chickenpox.description: A viral infection causing itchy red spots and blisters.
Chickenpox.treatment: Rest, drink fluids, apply calamine lotion, and avoid scratching. Consult a doctor if severe.

Acne.description: A common skin condition causing pimples, blackheads, or whiteheads.
Acne.treatment: Use gentle cleansers, topical benzoyl peroxide, avoid squeezing pimples, and maintain hygiene.

Eczema.description: A condition that makes skin red, itchy, and inflamed.
Eczema.treatment: Moisturize regularly, avoid irritants, use prescribed topical corticosteroids.

Lupus.description: An autoimmune disease that can affect skin and organs, causing rashes and inflammation.
Lupus.treatment: Avoid sun exposure, use prescribed medications, and consult a specialist.

Herpes.description: A viral infection causing painful blisters or sores, often around the mouth or genitals.
Herpes.treatment: Antiviral medications, avoid touching lesions, and maintain hygiene.

Melanoma.description: A serious form of skin cancer, usually appearing as dark, irregular moles or spots.
Melanoma.treatment: Immediate consultation with a dermatologist or oncologist is required.
